tac.machine

Class Machine

  • java.lang.Object
    • tac.machine.Machine

  • public class Machine
extends java.lang.Object
    Machines which execute abstract machine instructions. A machine has a read-only instruction-memory (first address 0), 256 registers and a data-memory. Instruction memory addresses address individual bytes. Data memory addresses address individual 32-bit words. Addresses (of both kinds) and data words are represented by int values.
    System calls supported:

    0: malloc: return start-address of allocated memory in RV (param RA: requested number of words)
    1: write a null-terminated string from memory to stdout (param RA: start address)
    2: write a single char to stdout (param RA: a Plane 0 Unicode code point)
    3: write a string representation of an integer to stdout (param RA: the integer)
    4: write a specified number of chars from memory to stdout (params RA: start address, RB: count)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void load(byte[] bytes)
      Initialise the machine with a new sequence of bytes.
      If the first byte is Assembler.MAGIC_NUMBER then the following 4 bytes will be interpreted as an int (bigendian), giving the length in bytes of the code segment, and any bytes after the code segment will be treated as data to be stored in the heap (this implies an upper size limit of Integer.MAX_VALUE bytes for the code segment).
      If the first byte is not Assembler.MAGIC_NUMBER, all bytes are treated as code.
      Registers SP and FP are initialised to the maximum memory address + 1.
      Register MEMLO is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code.
      Register MEMHI is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code or data.
      void load(byte[] bytes, int start, int codeSegmentSize)
      Initialise the machine with a new sequence of bytes.
      Registers SP and FP are initialised to the maximum memory address + 1.
      Register MEMLO is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code.
      Register MEMHI is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code or data.
      void loadData(byte[] data)
      Load bytes into the heap.
      void pushParameter(int value)
      Push a command-line parameter on to the call stack.
      void run()
      Execute the instruction sequence until the machine terminates.
      void showState()
      Debugging method.
      void step()
      Execute the next instruction.
      boolean terminated()
      Has the machine terminated?

      • DEFAULT_MEM_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_MEM_SIZE
        Default memory size in words. For example, if WORD_SIZE = 4 then a memory size of 1024 * 64 = 65536 words = 256KiB.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FIRST_GEN_PURPOSE_REGISTER

        public static final int FIRST_GEN_PURPOSE_REGISTER
        The first register not reserved for special purposes by the machine.

      • memSize

        public final int memSize
        Memory size in words. For example, if WORD_SIZE = 4 then a memory size of 1024 * 64 = 65536 words = 256KiB.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Machine

        public Machine(int memSize,
               boolean debug,
               boolean noMemCheck)
        Initialise a new machine with an empty code sequence. Use the load method to install a code sequence.
        Parameters:
        debug - Enable/disable debugging
        noMemCheck - Disable/enable checks for illegal memory access

      • Machine

        public Machine(boolean debug,
               boolean noMemCheck)
        Initialise a new machine with an empty code sequence and with default memory size. Use the load method to install a code sequence.
        Parameters:
        debug - Enable/disable debugging
        noMemCheck - Disable/enable checks for illegal memory access

      • Machine

        public Machine(boolean debug)
        Initialise a new machine with an empty code sequence, with default memory size and basic memory checks enabled. Use the load method to install a code sequence.
        Parameters:
        debug - Enable/disable debugging

      • Machine

        public Machine()
        Initialise a new machine with an empty code sequence, with default memory size, basic memory checks enabled and debugging disabled. Use the load method to install a code sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(byte[] bytes)
        Initialise the machine with a new sequence of bytes.
        If the first byte is Assembler.MAGIC_NUMBER then the following 4 bytes will be interpreted as an int (bigendian), giving the length in bytes of the code segment, and any bytes after the code segment will be treated as data to be stored in the heap (this implies an upper size limit of Integer.MAX_VALUE bytes for the code segment).
        If the first byte is not Assembler.MAGIC_NUMBER, all bytes are treated as code.
        Registers SP and FP are initialised to the maximum memory address + 1.
        Register MEMLO is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code.
        Register MEMHI is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code or data.

      • load

        public void load(byte[] bytes,
                 int start,
                 int codeSegmentSize)
        Initialise the machine with a new sequence of bytes.
        Registers SP and FP are initialised to the maximum memory address + 1.
        Register MEMLO is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code.
        Register MEMHI is initialised to the lowest word-aligned memory address which is not occupied by code or data.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to load
        start - index of the first code byte (any preceding bytes are ignored)
        codeSegmentSize - the number of code bytes (any following bytes are treated as data and stored in the heap)

      • loadData

        public void loadData(byte[] data)
        Load bytes into the heap.
        Parameters:
        data - the bytes to load into memory

      • pushParameter

        public void pushParameter(int value)
        Push a command-line parameter on to the call stack. Use this during machine initialisation to make command-line parameters available to the program. Note that FP is initialised to max memory address + 1, so command-line parameter 0 will be available at address FP-WORD_SIZE, command-line parameter 1 at FP-2*WORD_SIZE, and so on.
        Parameters:
        value - the parameter value

      • run

        public void run()
        Execute the instruction sequence until the machine terminates.

      • step

        public void step()
        Execute the next instruction. Does nothing if the machine has terminated.

      • terminated

        public boolean terminated()
        Has the machine terminated?
        Returns:
        true if the machine has terminated, false otherwise

      • showState

        public void showState()
        Debugging method. Print a textual representation of the current register state to standard out.
